channel.title: interactive on Environment & Health Data Portal
channel.description: Recent content in interactive on Environment & Health Data Portal

item.title: Real-time heat-related illness
item.description: Extreme heat is dangerous. It can cause heat-related illness, make chronic conditions worse, and even kill. The weather forecast is our best way to predict heat-related health outcomes. We can also track heat-related illness with near real-time electronic data from emergency departments at hospitals throughout NYC.

item.title: Your Neighborhood's Air Quality
item.description: We combine data from our air quality monitoring network, NYCCAS, with other data to understand what makes one neighborhood’s air quality different from another’s. We found that building emissions, building density, industrial areas, and traffic density are associated with differences in air quality. If we don’t have an air quality monitor in one neighborhood, but we know its building density, its industrial area, and its traffic, then we can model (estimate or predict) its air quality - based on monitored air quality in similar neighborhoods.
